definition: to weave/to plait/to organize/to group/to arrange/to edit/to compile/to write/to compose/to fabricate

sentences.english: What is American RMP? I just made that up.
sentences.chinese: 什么是美国RMP？我是瞎编出来的。

sentences.english: So there wasn't a saboteur at all. You made that up?
sentences.chinese: 所以根本没有破坏者你瞎编的？
他的故事是瞎编乱造的。

sentences.english: It just told that Mike cheated them for telling a scary story.
sentences.chinese: 主要说了迈克瞎编得一个吓人的故事。

sentences.english: The head of Internal Audit opened his mouth to say something reasonable, and didn't.
sentences.chinese: 内部审计主任开口说了一些合理的和瞎编的理由。

sentences.english: Light music is better than Rap.
sentences.chinese: 居然是对的，瞎编的音乐名。

sentences.english: It sounds like a Lassie TV episode, but it's truth, not fiction.
sentences.chinese: 这听起来像电视剧新灵犬莱西，但这是真的，不瞎编。

sentences.english: The excuse for her absence was obviously fabricated.
sentences.chinese: 她缺席的借口完全是瞎编的。

definition: to make things up/to concoct (a story, an excuse etc)
to concoct a cock-and-bull story (idiom)/to make things up
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
to talk random nonsense (idiom); to say whatever comes into one's head
to boast/to shoot one's mouth off
to compile/to draw up/to fabricate/to invent/to concoct/to make up/to cook up
to speak without thinking/to blurt sth out
to talk drivel/to assert sth without a proper understanding or basis in fact/not to know what one is talking about
